channel.title: RSPS becoming ruined?
channel.description:
I think that this is just becoming out of hand. Almost every server you see now days, is a Project Insanity with 600+ content, practicaly every server is now the same. The owners mostly say "Log in yourself, there's lot's of content!" When honestly, it is all tutorial based and 80% of the other servers have it.
RSPS is no longer unique, it is all Project Insanity loading 600+. If you're going to do that you may as well just move onto a higher revision instead of taking over the whole 317 world.
Anybody else agree that this is getting a bit out of hand?

item.title: RSPS becoming ruined?
item.dc:creator: @baddy351 baddy351
item.description:
@baddy351 wrote:

Well, something unique would be using your own everything xD. We are all leechers of runescape, remember this, even creating frameworks, we still load runescape cache. But i like RSPS, and i like it when people do stuff right, not PI, etc.

Read full topic

item.title: RSPS becoming ruined?
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

This is why I always try to make something unique in my projects. I also tell people their server’s are bullshit when the title says 317 and it has 508+ models.

It really infuriates me, although the majority should not speak for the minority. This new swarm of newbies that have came along from playing RS in the last two years, I believe, are the ones responsible for the mass leeching of the PI 508+ crap.

Because it’s so easy.

Read full topic

item.title: RSPS becoming ruined?
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

ollie123:

People want content and generally don’t care about speed and stability.

They do, they just don’t realize it.

Edit:

Also, it’s not really dependent on what the playerbase wants. It’s because all the developers are lazy.

Read full topic

item.title: RSPS becoming ruined?
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“Hidendra, post:32, topic:410869”]except you have to consider the user base that RSPS’ attract. Most people that call themselves “coders” (I cringe at this) are 12-15 years old and think 700 line methods are okay.

Throwing more frameworks at them doesn’t solve anything: these “coders” aren’t going to use them unless there are tutorials (when in reality, don’t teach you anything) for said framework. The ones that DO know how to use these frameworks (or even made them) most likely made them or use them as a learning experience, not to create an actual server (though some do, I guess.)[/quote]
Hyperion and RuneSource actually both have a ton of tutorials, people are just too lazy to add them (and there aren’t very many quality Hyperion-based servers released).

Read full topic

item.title: RSPS becoming ruined?
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

except you have to consider the user base that RSPS’ attract. Most people that call themselves “coders” (I cringe at this) are 12-15 years old and think 700 line methods are okay.

Throwing more frameworks at them doesn’t solve anything: these “coders” aren’t going to use them unless there are tutorials (when in reality, don’t teach you anything) for said framework. The ones that DO know how to use these frameworks (or even made them) most likely made them or use them as a learning experience, not to create an actual server (though some do, I guess.)

Read full topic

People need to start making frameworks, and more of it.

Why do people need to make new frameworks when we have perfectly serviceable ones already?
[/quote]
Like? Rs2Hd/RuneSource/Rs377d/Hyperion?
Hyperion/Rs2Hd have only have had very few servers hosted with 30+ people
(Proj Anni is an exception.)[/quote]
+Shard
A few are more than acceptably stable, and for people that use sources based on content, they have a fair amount added.
